dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Simonis, J. & Köhler, F. 2012. Brotia pagodula. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: This species is restricted to the Thoungyin River, a tributary of the Salween River which is called Moei River in Thailand and in some of the tributary rivers in Thailand. This river forms the border between Thailand and Myanmar, and it is found north to Sob Moei (F. Köhler pers. comm. 2010).

Habitat and Ecology

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Simonis, J. & Köhler, F. 2012. Brotia pagodula. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
LC
Least Concern

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2012

Assessor/s
Simonis, J. & Köhler, F.

Reviewer/s
Sri-aroon, P., Burch, J. & Seddon, M.

Contributor/s

Justification
This species is assessed as Least Concern because although it has a restricted range, at present there are no threats and it is abundant where found. Conservation actions include the implementation of catchment management plans to keep the river water well oxygenated and clean.

dataObjects.description:
Population
No information available on population trends, however the species is locally abundant where present, but not found throughout the range.

Population Trend
Unknown

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Threats
dataObjects.title: Threats
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Simonis, J. & Köhler, F. 2012. Brotia pagodula. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Major Threats

It is not believed to be threatened over its entire range, but may be locally threatened by impoundment of water by dams and pollution from domestic and agricultural sources over a small part of the river.

No species-specific conservation actions are known, but none are considered necessary.

dataObjects.subject: http://www.eol.org/voc/table_of_contents#Wikipedia
dataObjects.title: Brotia pagodula
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: "Brotia pagodula." Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. 16 Feb 2013, 04:36 UTC. 1 Sep 2014 <http://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Brotia_pagodula&oldid=623091524>.
dataObjects.description:
Brotia pagodula is a species of freshwater snail with an operculum, an aquatic gastropod mollusk in the family Pachychilidae.

Brotia pagodula is the type species of the genus Brotia.[2]

Distribution[edit]

Distribution map of Brotia pagodula.

This species occurs in:

  • Myanmar[1][2]
  • Thailand[1]
Apertural view of another shell of Brotia pagodula

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b c d Simonis J. & Köhler F. (2012). "Brotia pagodula". In: IUCN 2012. IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2012.2. <www.iucnredlist.org>. Downloaded on 5 November 2012.
  2. ^ a b Köhler F., Holford, Do V. T. & Ho T. H. (2009). "Exploring a largely unknown fauna: On the diversity of pachychilid freshwater gastropods in Vietnam (Caenogastropoda: Cerithioidea)". Molluscan Research 29(3): 121-146. abstract.
